text:
Academy Award-winner Alicia Vikander has made
quite a name for herself in film, going from

Swedish indie sensation to one of Hollywood's
hottest stars in just a few short years.

Most recently, the star delivered memorable
performances in Testament of Youth, Ex Machina,

The Man from U.N.C.L.E., The Danish Girl,
Jason Bourne, and The Light Between Oceans
— just to name a few.

While none of those roles required the actress
to become particularly "ripped," in the months

leading up to her long-awaited debut as Lara
Croft in 2018's Tomb Raider, Vikander got
positively jacked.

How did the lean actress go from ballet dancing
to raiding tombs?
Let's find out.

"When it comes to the action, Alicia is a
beast.
You have to see her in this movie, man."
Swan Lake

First and foremost, Vikander has an athletic
history — but one that doesn't exactly include

climbing cliff faces, avoiding deadly traps
and ziplining down ropes with only a pickaxe.

Vikander began ballet at the age of four before
enrolling at the Royal Swedish Ballet School.

However, the intense regimen proved too much
for the future star, who told Vanity Fair,

"Being in ballet school and being in leotards
in front of a mirror I don't know how many
hours a day was quite tough."

The high-pressure culture even landed Vikander
in therapy, which she hid from her parents.

Ultimately, those years of training led to
her unrelenting work ethic and flexible frame.

But what exactly did she do to pack on the
muscle?

"She made me embarrassed to take my shirt
off and I go to the gym five days a week"
The Magnus Method

Vikander enlisted the help of celebrity trainer
Magnus Lygdback — a world-renowned Swedish

health and wellness expert who's trained the
likes of Alexander Skarsgård, Britney Spears,

Ben Affleck, Gal Gadot, Katy Perry, and Harry
Styles, among others.

He's also famous for having developed the
"Magnus Method," an athlete-inspired training
philosophy which approaches fitness as a lifestyle.
"I wanted her to be a strong, physical girl.
So I started to gain muscle and gain strength."

Lygdback helped Vikander pack 16 pounds of
muscle onto her slim 5-foot-5 frame.
He told The Hollywood Reporter,

"Angelina did a great job, but this is something
completely different from the original movies.

It's a modern Lara Croft, a strong, independent
woman, and I think it's exactly what the world
needs right now."

Lygdback's workouts for Vikander primarily
focused on strength training.
He told PopSugar,

"We did everything from squatting heavy and
doing deadlifts to pull-ups, pushups, training

with machines, training with bodyweight, plyometrics,
explosive training.
We covered it all."

But everybody knows, effective tomb raiding
comes down to how you fuel.
Three squares and two snacks

According to USA Today, Vikander would start
the day with three poached eggs, followed

by a protein-rich snack of either artichoke
hummus or quinoa tabbouleh with feta, mint,
and lemon.

For lunch, she'd put down some fish or other
protein, paired with slow carbs from potatoes
or quinoa and vegetables.

Later came another snack, and then another
protein-rich dinner.
Total knockout

Vikander got into fighting shape by regularly
entering the ring, where she learned how to

tap out opponents with chokeholds and other
submissions.

Her sparring sessions would be followed by
squats, bear crawls, push-ups, chin-ups, and
medicine ball tosses.
The actress told E! News of her character,

"She's put through all these obstacles and
she has to bring out the skills that she has
within her..."

"... and also bring out the warrior within
her."
No days off

According to USA Today, Vikander's regimen
didn't stop once the filming of Tomb Raider
began.

She woke up every morning and hit the gym
before makeup, often as early as 4AM.

Think about that the next time you want to
snooze through breakfast.

But even though Vikander was on her training
grind 6 to 7 days a week, she still required
rest.

For the hard-working star, however, slowing
down is rarely easy.
Lygdback explained to USA Today,

"She needs someone like me [to say], 'It's
OK.
We're going to take a step back.
Take a day off.
Relax.'"
8-pack abs

The fruits of Vikander's labors are certainly
on display in Tomb Raider, where she has a

chance to show off all that muscle she packed
onto her frame.

But while most people would kill for six-pack
abs, Vikander's sporting a ridiculous eight-pack.

According to Lygdback, that's thanks to his
patented methods.
He told PopSugar,

"I also did Tarzan with Alexander Skarsgård,
and he had an eight-pack as well.
I have a specific way of working the core.

I divide the core into three different days,
and I approach the core differently every
day."
The new Lara

Vikander sees her version of Lara Croft as
a positive role model for young women — a

viewpoint not traditionally held by many throughout
the history of the video game character.
"She gets hit, but she stands up again."
She told Marie Claire,

"I very much see her as a model for many young
women.

She also has a fantastic mix of traits — tough,
smart, vulnerable, plus she's kick ass!"
Thanks for watching!

Click the Looper icon to subscribe to our
YouTube channel.

Plus check out all this cool stuff we know
you'll love, too!
